metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1935 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.30, 8.5.0 to 8.5.50 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.99 the HTTP header parsing code used an approach to end-of-line parsing that allowed some invalid HTTP headers to be parsed as valid. This led to a possibility of HTTP Request Smuggling if Tomcat was located behind a reverse proxy that incorrectly handled the invalid Transfer-Encoding header in a particular manner. Such a reverse proxy is considered unlikely.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.13').
